title: Art Insights: The American Environment in the 20th Century
hero_caption: Edward Hopper. Nighthawks, 1942. Friends of American Art Collection.
header_description: This program will take place from 11:00 a.m.–12:00 p.m. CST.
description:
Art Insights provides a historical and enlightening art-enrichment experience for older members of the community who are unable to visit the Art Institute in person. The Art Institute is pleased to partner with Mather LifeWays Telephone Topics to provide telephone-based Art Insights conversations on a national scale. A telephone is required to participate in this program.

Art Institute of Chicago volunteer lecturer Kit Keane leads a lively discussion of ways in which American artists of the 20th century portray our country’s culture, landscape, and diversity of people and places. Transformative events, technology, and social movements stirred the art community in the same way our daily lives were “stirred” while growing up during this remarkable and memorable century.

This telephone presentation is hosted by Mather Lifeways, a non-denominational not-for-profit organization dedicated to serving older adults. For more information or to register, please call 1 (888) 600-2560 or email teltopics@matherlifeways.com.
buy_button_caption: To register, please call 1 (888) 600-2560 or email teltopics@matherlifeways.com.
